intro: Senecio balsapampae, commonly known as the Pampas Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small yellow to orange flowers that are arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
